derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as an adjective): from medieval Latin collateralis, from col- 'together with' + lateralis (from latus, later- 'side'). Sense 1 (originally US) is from the phrase collateral security, denoting something pledged in addition to the main obligation of a contract

entry.def: Collateral is money or property which is used as a guarantee that someone will repay a loan.

example.ex: Many people use personal assets as collateral for small business loans...
example.tran: 很多人把个人财产用作小额商业贷款的抵押品。
